bow: did you feel any positive emotions during labor if so can you describe them removed honestly do remember having emotions during labour slept through lot of it in between contractions and during contractions and pushing was just focusing on the pain had natural birth and in retrospect the experience was positive and hope to do it again but do remember thinking positively or negatively during the process do remember feeling emotional one way or the other remember being so tired and in lot of pain but that about it during contractions retreated inside myself and focused on breathing and low pitched moaning it was very animalistic between contractions was talking and laughing and normal then when went into transition and there was no break between went inside myself and didnt come out until it was over when it was over cackled like mad woman as they placed my son on my chest it was the best feeling in the world so much oxytocin so much love nothing will ever beat it how long did transition last why was the experience positive when was in active labor the pain was so intense it was all felt no emotion even when they had me changing positions because his pulse was slowing did panic because did have the capacity to think of anything besides pushing and breathing it very strange feeling but glad was able to stay calm unfortunately it lasted hours my son was born in compound presentation he came out with fist by his cheek very painful long transition was trying for natural but had some fentanyl right at the last cm no regrets my labor was way easier for me than thought was scared to death of giving birth for about month before the big moment think psyching myself out actually led to positive experience for me it was as bad as thought it would be pain wise mix that with my excitement to meet baby and my amazing support team husband kickass doctor and nurses made the entire thing really awesome felt so empowered ve never felt more proud of myself there is totally reason why they say many mom go back for seconds thirds etc well it was amazing because was about to meet my baby labored for 24 hours without meds and lot of it was intense more than painful some was painful but more like just went to my secret inner place then came back my husband took video of me walking the halls singing and dancing between contractions oh totally have you ever tried hallucinogens it was absolutely like that there were waves of intense pain sure but then in between felt almost euphoric it the oxytocin that said got the epidural 12 hours in then ended up in still was grateful to go into labor naturally with the first baby was induced and afraid it was like that pitocin is sad substitute for the real thing my labor was incredibly quick for first baby hrs from hospital admission to baby so it was all so overwhelming and intense that was not in great place but there was moment once was dilated and before pushing that was really calm remember sitting in the tub and just absolute stillness it was like being world away everyone else disappeared it was pretty cool then the baby throttled out of me in like 15 minutes and it was intense again haha was exhausted and in pain but pretty happy during the contractions was more apprehensive my water bag had burst and was worried that if did dilate quickly enough would need an emergency section but when it came to active labor was literally laughing it felt right to push and was really excited to see my little girl it sounds crazy my labor was really quick it hard to remember my emotions my contractions were so close together could barely catch my breath in between just remember breathing deep trying to relax and focus on my soothing music and reminding myself this was all so could have my baby in my arms well was incredibly excited to not be pregnant anymore sooooooo happy about it that was practically giddy it was like getting out of jail or something almost forgot there was going to be baby afterward hate being pregnant as am very sick the whole time and ca take some of the medicines that really help me also felt pretty happy when got my epidural all in all it was fairly pleasant experience but had drugs so was in pain and was anticipating not being pregnant again and it was an exciting and much anticipated event my family was there and hung out with me until it came time to push etc imagine you re looking more for nonmedicated experiences since you mentioned the pain but mine was really happy and enjoyable as medicated relaxed labor did get the epi until was cm due to some miscommunication so did labor for while with pain but it was that terrible and had the excitement of not being pregnant fueling me was excited and nervous know there were hard moments and significant pain but your brain does fabulous job of making you forget all the negative emotions had two unmedicated labors and both were positive experiences clearly remember with my first that just went inside my head during all except the pushing part in my head was cracking jokes and having grand ol time but on the outside was almost completely silent if opened my mouth everything that came out with negative and honestly it surprised me the contractions were painful so much as wildly uncomfortable the only actual pain was ripping and being sewn back up the hypnobabies method worked wonders for me both in labor and in recovery hindsight is 20 20 at the end it immense relief that baby is out and ok and that that contractions are over the only thing remember feeling was righteous determination to push so did have to have any more contractions had very emotional 72 hr labor with no pain meds my only emotions were oh my god please kill me watch the documentary orgasmic birth and prepare to be amazed you could also read som ina may gaskin do know if can exactly say that during the process was having positive emotions other than the excitement mixed with curiosity say that when look back at the whole experience remember all the parts even the crappy painful stuff with positive tone seeing that beautiful baby and having my heart explode left positivity on the whole experience for me removed none whatsoever just fear it was traumatic experience never to be repeated did you experience any of that in your labor ve had two labors our first was an emergency section because she was breech the second was vaginal delivery and it was incredible felt empowered physically strong totally in control euphoric excited relaxed when contraction was over the only terrible pain was prior to my epidural could see straight was seeing red and hated everyone drugs are awesome and made my labor wonderful and very enjoyable could seriously birth 10 more kids it was that awesome remember thinking about how weird all of it was my water broke when was at home and did give birth until like 13 hours later so had plenty of time to have emotions had music playing for while and my husband and watched few episodes of family feud walked bit until got my epidural then kept happy thoughts in my head of finally getting the baby out of me was only concerned about the baby once active labor started nothing else got giddy happy and remember crying happy tears once saw my baby there was fear as well but it eclipsed by the hormones that you produce during this process think there not really good way to describe or equate the level of feelings had when experiencing the birth of my child except that they were singular in nature it not quite like anything else can order some of that maniacal cackling that actually sounds awesome removed no joy worry excitement before terror during drawn out lingering terror depression after sincere concern that would never love my kid would break down in tears just trying to think the words love you at her subsequent guilt from feeling that way continued emotional spiral improved now with help medication normalization of hormones and tincture of time took about years would like another kid but do want to go through that again oh am so relieved to hear pitocin is sad substitute had my waters broken for 30 hours before needing induction for labour to start really hoping to avoid that this time because of the enormous rush of feel good hormones at the end and the love most mothers feel for their children and the fact that unless the experience in this case birth is exceptionally traumatic human beings are wired to forget the negative parts of most experiences so the past tends to be viewed through rose coloured glasses of course it painful and stressful and for some women truly traumatic but you get this beautiful gift at the end of it if you had to walk through field of manure on hot day but got the biggest love of your life out of it at the end you ultimately probably describe the overall experience as positive no did feel any pain after the epidural it was amazing was cracking jokes about being on display with my bestie and was having great time when it came time to push felt this great sense of accomplishment had fairly easy and quick labor six and half hours from my first contraction to birth labored at home for about of them once he was born and placed on me the rush of love and happiness made me cry like crazy do want to be pregnant again but the labor was no big deal removed sense of achievement always wanted natural birth and am also qualified doula so section is my nightmare this is exactly how think ll be 14 weeks with my first and ve been brutally sick since about days in feel like losing my mind vomiting and constant nausea will do that to someone after well shoot month but once you re at 3+ months it just depressing anyways ca wait to not be pregnant and to just be mom lot older than my brother and helped raise him and was nanny from 14 till just couple years ago 34 so as prepared as can be for baby pregnant on the other hand everyone ve known has had such nice pregnancies and just want to crawl into hole went pretty fast went to the hospital at cm when they rechecked me shortly after was at think could have gone naturally but it would have been brutal and quick instead got the epidural as soon as it hit my legs my natural endorphins kicked in it was fantastic felt great could still feel my baby and knew when to push no one counted in my face since we were doing fine everyone was quiet and just let me do my thing all in all good memory the peds nurse on the other hand super obnoxious first baby my water broke before contractions started and then they increased in intensity gradually starting very mild and hardly noticeable water broke at 2:30am contractions sent me to birth center at 8pm felt elation when felt things were kicking into action that intense excitement like kid on christmas eve then serious contractions was very focused and wanted quiet during contractions wanted to chat and be normal in between as labor kicked up it turned into all focus zoned out like was all there and remember it but time ceased to have meaning and was only in the moment did realize until after that my husband waved shower sprayer on my back for an hours seriously good pain relief pushing just hurt was tired and so ready to be done wanted to throw up with each push then they told me could feel his head and cried with joy it was so powerful it gave me the strength to keep going and of course the best is when it over and you hold your baby it such joyous moment seeing this kid face after carrying him for so long cried then too second baby faster birth woke up to contractions at 3am went in at 6am more focused on my checklist to get everything we needed and kid in care of grandparents once was at birth center got very zen and into the zone total silence was perfect then excitement when realized how quickly was progressing then painful pushing it helped me to grab on to my husband and tell my nurse how much it hurt she was sweet and having someone validate my pain was soothing then baby was here in 10 pushes about 30 min was so happy and less exhausted than my first birth yelled we did it to my husband and cried when got to hold baby the ending is just amazing the bliss and awe over this tiny person is such beautiful thing found the bradley method book helpful in preparing for what labor would look feel like knew that likely have feelings of doubt or ca do this right before the big moment and that helped me not feel so down when it came meditation would be helpful think practicing just being acknowledging your passing thoughts feelings but not being battered by them did tai chi previously and found that it helped me to draw on meditative imagery we had done there removed removed removed always describe mine as intense rather than painful as well had back labor and that what it was just intense do know if this counts but when was in the end stages of labor with my first kicked the doctor in the face personally consider that positive for me at least so sorry was in labor back labor the whole time for 56 hours with my youngest and did get an epidural until hour 48 before got it was mess had toddler to take care of so was cranky and tired and was having contractions min apart the entire time was in labor ended up having to walk circle around the maternity ward for 2hours before started showing progress and was finally admitted to the hospital was grumpy angry and in pain then ended up having to push for hours after all that of course the epidural had worn off at this point with me falling asleep between each contraction due to the sleep deprivation and exertion and they still had to use the vacuum to finally get her out stubborn little thing ymmv but did really feel any joy or excitement until that child came out then it was sudden flood of happiness strength just pushed freaking human out of my body excitement that made it through one of the hardest things ve ever done and hunger since could eat with the epidural and all the labor pain had disappeared almost immediately it was such huge relief but of course everyone labor is different you may have an easy birth with no complications or hiccups whatsoever and be happy as clam through all of it you could also be like me with my first daughter it was probably the most traumatic thing to happen to me to date mostly because had an emergency section after only hours of labor after had told myself would have and prepared myself thoroughly for completely natural birth never really emotionally recovered from that birth since was even entertaining the possibility that would have to get section was young and naive and woefully unprepared for that eventuality never read up on it learned what to expect recovery time etc was also forced to be put out completely for the surgery since an epidural or spinal would have taken too long to start working and the baby needed to get out now it happened fast they literally had me sign the consent form for the surgery as was passing out from the anesthesia on the operating table did get to see my baby until the next day since could walk because of the pain and my hospital bed would fit in the nicu could even hold her until few days after that the first time saw her face was picture my mom took of her my biggest piece of advice if you re even still reading this is to prepare for anything to happen your birth plan may just be thrown out the window depending on so many factors that nobody could predict or it may go exactly how you planned ask other women about their childbirth stories and for advice on what to expect can only speak for myself but love to educate other women with my story if this novel was big enough clue and hopefully did scare you too bad with my crazy births but the one thing can guarantee is that the joy and ecstasy you feel when you see hear your baby for the first time will supersede any negative emotions you may have felt during birth labor recovery good luck you got this ended up getting epiderals at different points in my labors with the epideral the nap was positive plus the actual birth itself the first one was so surreal but the second was more flat out enjoyable since already knew the ropes was just focused and concentrated then when he arrived we spent an hour regarding each other with cautious interest was relieved that neither he nor had died so positive but not probably what you would imagine given the circumstances it was pleasant experience but would say have had positive emotions this was three weeks ago so recent memories had to go in for an induction after the nonsense hours to even get in and settled everyone there was lovely my mom and so were with me the whole time after hours on pitocen got an epidural 22 hours later was told needed section cried lot got prepped my so came with me and out came my son the only truly positive feelings felt were the ones had after the epidural but as pleasant as the whole experience was would say had any positive emotions related to my labor was mainly nervous and scared and upset scared when was told needed section why was it pleasant both my labors were very quick active labor with my second was whopping 15 minutes so do really remember feeling one way or another about it until it was over the huge rush of oxytocin and the shiny new baby you get at the end help turn it into positive experience though ve always joked that otherwise no one would do it more than once the only emotion remember feeling was get her out of me now maybe that was positive did lot of deep meditation that was mistaken for sleeping was asleep trying to stay focused on keeping myself calm through the pain that went all the way from my upper sternum down to my knees and around to my back tried to stay positive but it was difficult my guess is that it was very weird and eery for the constant in room nurse did have that had abnormal labor with no break between contractions had few breaks over the course of the 38hrs was in labor ended up with section during which after met him thank god started to feel it and they knocked me out was feeling excited for the first oh 6hrs or so at home where they were very very mild after that was pretty darn unhappy and scared until he was born of course having him finally there was wonderful but was still in pain so nope you were feeling pretty positive you wanted her out felt serious connection with my husband showing such emotion he was scared excited and protective all rolled into supportive bundle fell in love with him again with both of my deliveries after giving birth and eventually giving the baby to my partner literally bounced into the shower singing that was pregnant any more immediately started being able to eat and drink again and felt amazing took new while longer to warm up to baby but even at nearly months am still appreciating not being pregnant had an epidural was extremely happy and calm during it ended up needing forceps delivery and when it was over my midwife and doctor both told me that am the most positive person they ve ever met was just so happy to be done being pregnant that could stop smiling pushed for an hour her head was *right there* for an hour had to push with all my might telling myself can do it the sweet relief when heard her cry do remember feeling all happy like during labor but was running on endorphins for 48 hours most of the emotions had during my second labor were positive would say 90 with maybe 10 anxiety the pain sucked yes but tried to stay ahead of it by thinking this is normal mum body knows what it doing and when you think about it it pretty cool that your body takes over and does what it needs to do like primal anyway the type who feels more calm when carefully monitored by medical professionals so let them hook me up to wires and watch baby heart rate and my blood pressure they reassure me that everything was normal and relax and breathe through the contractions until the pain got too intense then got the epidural for me the biggest thing was feeling like was in control when was able to look at all my options and decide what to do before got overwhelmed was able to relax and enjoy even savor the birth process my best friend came in to hang out with me and my husband we were listening to music and watching cat videos til it was time to push it was an awesome day do it again in second honestly if all labors were like my daughter could easily do it again she was vbac vaginal birth after section so my emotions going in were so different than my son remember being so excited and in awe of what my body was doing almost the entire time the only time started to falter was during transition but had awesome support so even then it was still so positive think it also helped the entire experience was hours from first noticeable contraction to delivery much longer and can see exhaustion worry and fear setting in my son birth while positive outcome with positive moments was little more negative when thinking back an induction turned emergency section however it was still beautiful experience because always felt supported just traumatized from my baby being in danger that what happened to me the first time except back then they only wait 12 hour post water breaking with my second was weeks overdue and they been on me to have section for days was so not into that finally was able to get labor started through nipple stim good luck to you hope it much more positive experience wonder how long after the births these studies were done know felt horrible while giving birth worst pain ever no meds and was in labor for days even remember thinking soon after never want to do this again so ll have to say goodbye to my dream of having at least kids but at the moment yrs later when think back think to myself it was so bad and it felt so good to be close to meeting my baby was induced and ended up having near constant back labor for 36 hours so no positivity there toward the end finally gave in and let the cheerful nurse get me all the drugs it took three tries to get my epidural right but by the time it did kick in it was time to push and it was at the perfect level could feel everything but it was painful so pushing was my positive owned it three pushes and she was out felt very in control of things at that moment feeling had had in the last two months of my pregnancy due to move and some medical chaos it felt good and not just because of the oxytocin nope none here seems like when it really got going it happened so fast real labor for an hour maybe that was fine but during transition thought was going to die they finally got an epidural in and checked me and was cm had flash backs about transition when tried to to go sleep for weeks only happy emotions afterward thanks everyone is different it is amazing just how different though my labor was 29 hours and some points of it were painful or intense but overall it was wonderful experience got an epidural at cm and then was able to take naps while waiting for my body to dilate to 10 cm over all those hours sometimes the epidural would wear off and had to get extra anesthesia because there were places on my body that the epidural just would consistently work on like my left side from like hip to lower tummy and there was point where got cervical check hours into labor and felt it entirely so they had to get me more anesthesia the worst part of my labor was when got bored from having to be in bed for so long without being able to move or stand but could do anything about it once got to the actual pushing had my husband next to me cheering me on and feeding me ice cubes between contractions because pushing so hard was making my mouth so dry making me thirsty it was like an awesome reward in between these huge back to back pushes when had contraction and my labor nurse was so sweet she kept telling me was doing an awesome job and telling me how much longer would have to push to get my little baby out once we got closer to her actually being born pushed for an hour and half there were lot more people in the room like nurses my ob tech and my husband and everybody kept cheering me on and telling me was pushing great so that was really cool to be cheered on by whole room of people and that support made my birth very positive experience and then of course had the excitement of knowing that if push really hard and give it my all at every contraction difficult with how exhausted pushing made me but focused on the outcome and not how tired was get to meet my baby soon so did that and then she came out and it was incredible like my nurse commented that she loved the expressions had made during labor and then when she was born just had this look of utter amazement and disbelief was so nervous to give birth but everything went so much smoother than imagined it would love thinking back to the whole experience like all 29 hours haha it was the rush was overwhelming and thats how it had to come out lol actually said this right before it was time to push told my hubby to take me outside and blow my brains out lol removed once was in the labor room every member of staff was so nice and friendly my mom and so were there and we talked and played uno once had the epidural was finally pain free for the first time in months and got better sleep than had in months as well it was peaceful my experience as well already planning husbands vasectomy we do even want to risk it felt like the world went blank during my contractions between them was pretty normal taking and all do like to be touched or to talk while in pain and no one respected that it was induced and it lasted for about 24 hours from checking in the hospital to having baby in my arms it was very good experience for me mainly because of myself asked the nurse if she could give me time estimation and she said maybe four more hours could be less or more so thought the pain would get much worse when in fact was seconds from pushing time so kept repeating could do it all anymore got an epidural that made me feel absolutely pain or anything at all could even push then booom baby on my last one was laughing and joking around up until they broke my water and contractions got pretty nasty even then remember being pretty excited about it all except the nurses behavior they really are the only negative out of both of my birth experiences the nurses for my first were amazing the second batch need to reconsider their career choice though allowed my family to come into the room for majority of my labor and think that helped keep me distracted from the
